item.title: Mobikwik Share Price Live Updates: Stock hits 20% upper circuit after stellar listing; Should you hold or book profit? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Mobikwik Shares Surge 20% on Stellar Market Debut

Date: 18 Dec, 2024 Source: LiveMint

The equity shares of One MobiKwik Systems Ltd experienced a remarkable debut on December 18, 2024, with shares closing at a 20% upper circuit.

  • Shares listed at ₹440 on NSE with a premium of 57.71%.
  • Closing price of ₹530.70 on BSE, an increase of nearly 90.22% from the issue price.
  • The IPO had garnered significant investor interest, being oversubscribed 125.69 times.
  • The IPO raised ₹572 crore for business expansion and technological investments.
  • Investors are advised to hold for the long term given the company's growth potential.
"Mobikwik is the largest wallet player in India with 23.11% market share of the PPI wallet gross transaction values." - Market Analyst

This stellar debut reflects strong demand and investor confidence, marking a notable moment for the fintech sector.

item.title: Fed set to deliver 3rd rate cut and Honda Nissan merger - what’s moving markets - Investing.com
item.description:
Fed Set to Deliver 3rd Rate Cut and Honda-Nissan Merger: What’s Moving Markets

Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: Investing.com

The Federal Reserve is poised to implement its third consecutive interest rate cut, with US stock futures trending upwards, and automakers Honda and Nissan reportedly in merger discussions.

  • The Fed is expected to cut rates by 25 basis points during its final policy meeting of the year.
  • Investors are looking for insights from Chair Jerome Powell regarding future rate cuts.
  • Honda and Nissan are exploring a merger amid challenges in the electric vehicle sector.
  • Oil prices are fluctuating as traders await the Fed's decision and assess implications of new sanctions on Russia.
  • Recent data shows robust consumer spending, a key driver of economic growth.
“Our baseline forecast is that it cuts again on 29 January, because we expect the incoming labour market data to soften further,” - Standard Chartered.

This potential rate cut and corporate merger highlight significant movements in the financial markets and automotive industry, likely impacting investors and consumers alike.

item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Remain Down As ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank Share Prices Drag - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Remain Down As ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank Share Prices Drag

Date: 18 Dec 2024, Source: NDTV Profit

On December 18, Indian stock markets showed a downward trend with the Nifty 50 and Sensex facing declines, largely attributed to falling share prices of ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank.

Key Points:

  • Traders are facing issues authorizing stock sales due to problems at CDSL.
  • VA Tech Wabag's share price has plummeted the most in four years.
  • The rupee has weakened to a record low of 84.95 against the US dollar.

The domestic currency depreciated by 5 paise during the day, nearing a critical 85 mark.

Market sentiment is cautious as investors await further developments from key global financial institutions.

item.title: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal is India's 2nd biggest self-made entrepreneur - check top 10 in new Hurun list - The Times of India
item.description:
Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal is India's 2nd biggest self-made entrepreneur - check top 10 in new Hurun list

Publication Date: Unknown, Source: Unknown

Deepinder Goyal, the CEO of Zomato, has secured the second position in the latest Hurun list of self-made entrepreneurs in India, highlighting the growth of the food delivery industry and Goyal's impactful leadership.

  • Deepinder Goyal has been recognized for his contributions to Zomato.
  • Zomato's growth reflects the increasing popularity of food tech in India.
  • The Hurun list ranks the wealthiest self-made entrepreneurs in India.
"Success in business comes from the relentless pursuit of excellence." - Deepinder Goyal

Goyal’s recognition emphasizes the potential of the food delivery sector in India, marking a significant milestone in India's entrepreneurial landscape.

item.title: Sai Life Sciences shares jump 16% post listing. Should you buy, sell or hold? - The Economic Times
item.description:
Sai Life Sciences shares jump 16% post listing. Should you buy, sell or hold?

Publication Date: Wednesday
Source: The Economic Times

Shares of Sai Life Sciences jumped 16% to Rs 764.4 on the BSE after their debut on the exchanges. The stock debuted at Rs 650 on the BSE, which is an 18% premium over the IPO price of Rs 549.

  • The stock has surged 39% from the issue price.
  • Experts recommend cautious profit booking but suggest holding for long-term investors.
  • The IPO had decent demand primarily from institutional investors.
  • Sai Life Sciences offers end-to-end services in drug discovery and manufacturing for pharmaceutical companies.
  • The global market for small molecule contract research is forecasted to reach $159 billion by 2028.
"While the company’s positive financial performance and rising profitability are encouraging, the limited direct benefits from the IPO proceeds may lead to cautious investor sentiment in the long term." - Shivani Nyati, Head of Wealth at Swastika Investmart

Investors should weigh the immediate gains against potential long-term stability and market volatility.

item.title: ‘It’s dumb to IPO this year’: Databricks CEO explains why he’s waiting to go public - TechCrunch
item.description:
Databricks CEO Waiting Until 2025 for IPO Due to Market Conditions

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: TechCrunch

Databricks recently raised $10 billion and feels it's unwise to proceed with an IPO in 2024 due to market instability. CEO Ali Ghodsi states that the economic environment, influenced by interest rates and inflation, makes now an unsuitable time for going public.

  • Databricks closed one of the largest funding rounds ever, raising $10 billion.
  • Ghodsi claims it's unwise to pursue an IPO during an election year and cites market instability.
  • While Databricks considers going public in 2025, CEO highlights that it may also extend to 2026.
  • The company aims for liquidity for employees but prioritizes market conditions over urgency to IPO.
  • Ghodsi points out that current valuations in the AI sector are part of an 'AI bubble'.
“It’s dumb to IPO this year,” said Ghodsi. “You get billion-dollar valuations on these startups that have nothing – that’s a bubble.”

Databricks is focused on positioning itself for future growth rather than rushing into an IPO under current conditions.

item.title: SEBI bans YouTube influencer with 19 lakh-plus subscribers for investment scam; fines Rs 9.5 crore - The Times of India
item.description:
SEBI bans YouTube influencer with 19 lakh-plus subscribers for investment scam; fines Rs 9.5 crore

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

This article discusses the action taken by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) against a popular YouTube influencer for an investment scam that scammed numerous people out of their money.

  • SEBI has imposed a ban on a YouTube influencer with over 1.9 million subscribers.
  • The influencer has been fined a total of Rs 9.5 crore for their involvement in fraudulent investment schemes.
  • The action follows complaints from affected investors about misleading financial advice and promotion of scam investment plans.
"Influencers must recognize their responsibility and the potential impact of their advice on vulnerable investors."

This incident highlights the growing scrutiny on social media influencers and the importance of transparency and accountability in financial advice.

item.title: Will Yes Bank’s turnaround story have a happy ending? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Will Yes Bank’s turnaround story have a happy ending?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) bailout of Yes Bank has made its turnaround a focal point for investors and traders. Few turnaround stocks have successfully delivered returns to shareholders who bought the dip—Yes Bank being one of them.

  • Yes Bank's share price fell sharply in 2020 due to an RBI crackdown on bad loans.
  • The RBI intervened, took over the bank, and initiated a reconstruction plan.
  • The significant volatility of Yes Bank's stock attracted traders and short-term investors.
  • Technical analysts have extensively covered Yes Bank during its tumultuous period.
“Few turnaround stocks have successfully delivered returns to shareholders who bought the dip—Yes Bank being one of them.”

The future performance of Yes Bank remains uncertain as the market watches its recovery closely.

item.title: Companies ramp up diversity hiring in campus placements to woo investors, impress public | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Companies ramp up diversity hiring in campus placements to woo investors, impress public

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Company Business News

Companies in India are increasingly focusing on diversity hiring across various roles, aiming to improve their image with investors and the public.

  • Diversity hiring has reportedly risen for the 2025 batch compared to last year.
  • This trend is evident in fields such as software development and mechanical engineering.
  • Placement officers from multiple colleges have highlighted this growth in diversity-focused recruitment strategies.
"Companies are trying to present themselves as forward-thinking entities with good corporate governance norms."

This initiative by companies is aimed at not only fostering an inclusive workplace but also enhancing their attractiveness to investors.

item.title: NMDC shares fall as Karnataka government looks to increase duty on iron ore mining: Exclusive - CNBCTV18
item.description:
NMDC shares fall as Karnataka government looks to increase duty on iron ore mining: Exclusive

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: CNBC-TV18

Shares of NMDC Ltd. have dropped as the Karnataka government considers raising the duty on iron ore mining. This potential increase follows the Supreme Court's approval for retrospective collection of mining taxes from 2005.

  • NMDC shares fell up to 6% due to news of the potential duty increase.
  • Karnataka is significant for NMDC, contributing to roughly 35% of its overall operations.
  • The state intends to collect over ₹10,000 crore in iron ore duties this year.
  • The Supreme Court's previous approval may lead to financial implications in arrears estimated between ₹1.5 lakh crore to ₹2 lakh crore.
“This will have very large financial implications as the arrears may end up being to the tune of ₹1.5 lakh crore to ₹2 lakh crore.”

Currently, NMDC shares trade at ₹215.4, marking a 5.3% decline, while JSW Steel also sees a drop, trading 2% lower.

item.title: International Gemmological Institute IPO allotment on Wednesday; Steps to check status online - CNBCTV18
item.description:
International Gemmological Institute IPO Allotment Scheduled for December 18

Publication Date: December 18 | Source: None Provided

The International Gemmological Institute (India) Ltd. is finalizing the allotment of its Initial Public Offering (IPO) on December 18, with shares listing on the BSE and NSE on December 20.

The IPO, which garnered significant investor interest, was open for subscription from December 13 to 17. The price band ranged between ₹397 and ₹417 per share.

  • The IPO was oversubscribed 22 times.
  • Bids amounted to 197.83 crore shares compared to 5.85 crore shares on offer.
  • QIB subscription rate was 45.8 times.
  • NII segment saw a subscription of 24.84 times.
  • The employee category was subscribed 20.63 times.
  • The retail portion saw 11.21 times subscription.
“Successful applicants will receive shares in their demat accounts, and unsuccessful applicants will get refunds.”

For investors wanting to check their allotment status, they can visit the BSE, NSE, or the IPO registrar, KFin Technologies, with instructions provided for each platform.

The IPO aims to raise funds for acquiring IGI Belgium Group and IGI Netherlands Group, along with additional corporate purposes.

item.title: US Federal Reserve likely to cut interest rate for third straight time | Key points - Hindustan Times
item.description:
US Federal Reserve likely to cut interest rate for third straight time

Publication Date: Dec 18, 2024 10:25 AM IST

Source: HT News Desk

The US Federal Reserve is set to likely announce a third consecutive interest rate cut as officials meet in Washington. This decision will be accompanied by updated quarterly economic forecasts.

  • The Fed is expected to lower its benchmark rate by a quarter percentage point, with the new target range set to be 4.25% to 4.5%.
  • This new rate would still be above the median estimated at the September meeting, which was 2.9%.
  • Updates will include the “dot plot,” indicating expected rate cuts for the next year.
  • Initial projections for 2025 indicated only two rate cuts.
  • The Fed's statement is likely to maintain that risks for employment and inflation are balanced.
  • There may be a suggestion that interest rates will be lowered gradually.
  • Chief economist Tim Duy expects the Fed to maintain rates steady in January after this week's cut.

item.title: VA Tech Wabag shares fall 16% after cancellation of $317 million Saudi order - CNBCTV18
item.description:
VA Tech Wabag Shares Plunge 16% After $317 Million Order Cancellation in Saudi Arabia

Publication Date: Dec 17, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of VA Tech Wabag dropped sharply after the company announced the cancellation of a significant order in Saudi Arabia.

  • VA Tech Wabag's shares fell by 14% on December 18, 2024, after the cancellation of a $317 million order.
  • The order was for a 300 MLD Mega Sea Water Desalination Plant in Saudi Arabia.
  • The Saudi Water Authority notified the cancellation due to internal administrative procedures.
  • Shares opened at ₹1,575.3, marking a 20% decline from their peak of ₹1,944.
"The said tender stands cancelled pursuant to their internal administrative procedures," - VA Tech Wabag in a regulatory filing.

This cancellation not only affects the company's stock performance but also raises questions about future engagements with the Saudi authorities.

item.title: MobiKwik IPO Listing: Shares list at a ₹440, a 58% premium to its IPO price - CNBCTV18
item.description:
MobiKwik IPO Listing: Shares list at a ₹440, a 58% premium to its IPO price

Date & Source: March 2024, CNBC TV18

Shares of MobiKwik listed at a 58% premium to its IPO price, opening at ₹440 following strong investor demand during the IPO bidding process.

  • Shares listed at ₹440, up from an IPO price of ₹279.
  • The IPO raised ₹572 crore with a subscription rate of nearly 120 times the shares on offer.
  • Institutional investors saw a subscription rate of 119.5 times, while retail investors subscribed 134.67 times.
  • MobiKwik's business includes payment solutions, consumer credit, and investment services.
"All three investor categories placed bids worth over 100 times the total number of shares on offer for each category."

This successful IPO indicates strong market confidence in MobiKwik's future growth prospects, driven by expanding consumer engagement and digital finance solutions.
